sentences.sContent: ‘Good of you to arrive on time,’ George said, with heavy sarcasm (= very clear sarcasm ) .
sentences.sCn: “你到得真准时啊。”乔治不加掩饰地挖苦道。

trans.tranOther: a way of speaking or writing that involves saying the opposite of what you really mean in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed
